did.abstract: Miscellaneous ephemera relating to American radicalism of the early 20th century.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: American radicalism encompasses political, cultural and intellectual history of radical social movements in the U.S.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p: The American Radicalism Ephemera Collection comprises a variety of ephemera relating to radical movements of 20th century American, such as cartoons, newsletters, fliers, book catalogs, brochures, and more.

Cartoons include a 1938 postcard drawn by A. Redfield (cartoonist Syd Hoff) advocating a boycott of German, Japanese and Italian goods; a political cartoon "Ten Free Citizens" by Americans for the Corporate Enterprise System; and a Black Panther cartoon by Emory Douglas. The John Reed Club material relates to the First National Congress, May 30, 1932, and includes lists of national executive board members and clubs participating in the conference in Chicago, with delegates and membership numbers for each club. Also included are several "International Books" catalogs from International Publishers and some material relating to Dr. Benjamin Spock's peace activism.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: &scrc_name; has extensive holdings relating to American radicalism, among them the papers of Arna Wendell Bontemps, Earl Browder, Lillian Gilkes, Horace Gregory, Granville Hicks, Harry Roskolenko and John Spivak. Please refer to &subjindex; for a complete list of related manuscript collections and to &summitref; for related items in the Rare Books Department and general collection.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The majority of our archival and manuscript collections are housed offsite and require advanced notice for retrieval. Researchers are encouraged to contact us in advance concerning the collection material they wish to access for their research.
